intro: Corispermum orientale var. emarginatum, commonly known as the eastern bladderwrath, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant typically thrives in saline or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its seeds are encased in a bladder-like structure, which aids in seed dispersal. This variety is native to regions of eastern Asia, including China and the Russian Far East.
